contentrichtext.text: {{eastern name order|Szeglet Zsolt}} '''Zsolt Szeglet''' (born 4 May 1977 in [[Keszthely]], [[Zala]]) is a [[Hungary|Hungarian]] athlete specializing in the [[400 metres]]. He finished fifth at the [[2002 European Championships in Athletics]], and participated in the Olympic Games in [[2000 Summer Olympics|2000]] and [[2004 Summer Olympics|2004]]. Szeglet finished seventh with the Hungarian [[4 x 100 metres relay]] team, which consisted of [[Viktor Kovács]], [[Gábor Dobos]], [[Roland Németh]] and Szeglet, at the [[1999 World Championships in Athletics|1999 World Championships]]. His personal best time over 400 m is 45.43 seconds, achieved in May 2001 in [[College Station, TX|College Station]]. ==External links== * At one point he also wished to play for [http://www.forestforum.co.uk "Nottingham Forest Football Club] *{{iaaf name|id=137428|name=Zsolt Szeglet}} *[http://www.sports-reference.com/olympics/athletes/sz/zsolt-szeglet-1.html sports-reference] {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2010}} {{Footer Hungarian Athletics Championships winners in Men's 400 metres}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Szeglet, Zsolt | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = [[Athletics (sport)]] competitor | DATE OF BIRTH = 4 May 1977 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Szeglet, Zsolt}} [[Category:1977 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Hungarian sprinters]] [[Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2000 Summer Olympics]] [[Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2004 Summer Olympics]] [[Category:Olympic athletes of Hungary]] {{Hungary-athletics-bio-stub}}
